result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Matthew McCutcheon

Arraignment on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:59 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court with Defendant Corey Matthew McCutcheon. Intern Connor Smith in court, supervised by Attorney Holly Rockow for State of Wisconsin. INCLUDES: 22CF214 and 22CF324 both set for PH. S/T Officer Nicholas Lubow, NRPD; direct by Mr Smith. Record reflects identity of the DE.  Mr Smith asks the court to take judicial notice of bonds in 21CF896 and 21CF770, no objection, so noted. Cross by Atty Stanek. Redirect by Mr Smith. S/T Kelli Sosnowski; direct by Mr Smith. Same notice taken on the bond in 21CF770. Mr Smith and Atty Stanek argue bind over. Court questions Attys, who respond. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in 22CF214.  Court makes statements and based on the testimony finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in 22CF324.  Court confirms address of DE. Ms Sosnowski asks that DE be ordered to test. DE responds as to missed tests. Court orders DE to go to JSC to test today. The state recommends that DE test today and if successful, suspend testing temporarily. Court orders DE to test today before leaving building, if successful test, testing will be suspended until 7/25/22 with weekly phone contact with JSC. If test is positive, DE will continue testing per schedule. Adjourned: 2:31 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC.  gll   to ty 7/5

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF770, 21CF896, 21CM166, 22CF214, 22CF324 & 22CM160 (PLEAS):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jon Elton Stanek   DF:  Corey Matthew McCutcheon appeared. Case called at 9:14 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing. Atty Stanek states there is no agreement. ADA Ballo requesting 22CF324 be scheduled for trial. Court will send Branch 2 files to be scheduled for trial with JA. Will schedule Branch 4 files for trial. Notes 22CF214 & 22CF324 has not had a preliminary hearing. 22CM160 to be scheduled for trial. ADA Ballo states DE had a positive test. Requesting Court order DE to test today. Court will order DE to report to JSC after Court for testing. Court orders all final pre trial submissions to be filed on 22CM160 10 days in advance of final pre trial date. Court adjourned at 9:28 a.m.

11:08 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Jon Elton Stanek, DF: Corey Matthew McCutcheon appeared from jail. Includes 22CM160 STC and 22CF324 INIT. Court reviews case. Court notes DE has 3 other pending files. ADA Ballo states RMW agreed to hear all cases and request Court to approve transfer to Branch 4. Court will Judicially transfer to Branch 4, if not resolved to return back to branch 3. 22CF324: DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court quashes all warrants. Court Judicially transfers all open cases to Branch 4. Court sets PLEAS in Branch 4. - I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 1x times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
